description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cravings: What Your Brain Really Wants.

hook.text: You just ate dinner. You're full. But your brain screams for chocolate. That craving isn't about hunger.

buildup.text: Cravings originate in the brain's reward circuits, not the stomach. They're driven by dopamine anticipation.

discovery.text: Brain imaging shows that food cravings activate the same regions as drug cravings â€” hippocampus and insula.

twist.text: The myth that cravings signal nutrient deficiency has been debunked â€” there's no link between the two.

climax.text: Cravings are triggered by cues: time of day, emotions, smells, and even advertisements seen hours earlier.

punchline.text: Cravings aren't your body talking. They're your reward system remembering.
